<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
JOBS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/26/33m-americans-filed-unemployment-last-week?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Chart You'll Never Forget
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="unemployment chart " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNjQvdW5lbXBsb3ltZW50X2NoYXJ0LnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://www.epi.org/press/unemployment-insurance-claims-jumped-nearly-1500-in-two-weeks-i-have-been-a-labor-economist-for-a-very-long-time-and-have-never-seen-anything-like-this/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Economic Policy Institute</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Imagine the entire state of Utah filing for unemployment. Yesterday morning, the Labor Department reported something pretty darn close: almost <a href="https://apnews.com/1bae3794481cc9d02fc670480cfcb800?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">3.3 million Americans</a> filed for unemployment last week, the department’s biggest spike on record.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Unemployment applications generally mirror the rate of layoffs. So when claims jump by 3 million in a week, it’s safe to say coronavirus is ravaging the U.S. economy.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Is this everyone? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not even close. Gig workers, freelancers, and the self-employed aren’t eligible for unemployment yet. Nor do jobless claims account for the millions of workers who’ve had hours dramatically reduced or their pay cut. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The pace is unprecedented. </strong>In February, unemployment hit a half-century low of 3.5%. Last week’s filings are expected to <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/03/26/821580191/unemployment-claims-expected-to-shatter-records?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">push that</a> to 5.5% and, if the pandemic and economy worsen, near 13%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">By the end of May, the U.S. could lose twice as many jobs as it did during the Great Recession. Globally, the UN predicts up to 25 million jobs lost.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Stimulus to the rescue?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Treasury Sec. Steve Mnuchin said yesterday’s unemployment numbers are “<a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/03/26/economy/unemployment-benefits-coronavirus/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not relevant</a>” since claims were filed before the Senate passed a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/senate-passes-2-trillion-stimulus-bill?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$2.2 trillion stimulus package</a>. He said businesses that receive stimulus benefits “hopefully will be able to hire back a lot of those people.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi pledged to pass the stimulus today. The bill would expand unemployment benefits including 13 additional weeks of benefits, extra weekly payments of up to $600 for four months, and benefits for individuals not on company payrolls, like gig economy workers. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Those changes should allow the average worker to receive roughly </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/03/25/821514231/whats-in-it-for-you-1-200-checks-13-weeks-of-unemployment-payments-and-more?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">100% wage replacement</a></span><span>, NPR reports. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A separate bill provides $1 billion to states to help process claims. Many unemployment agencies are working with historically low funding and staffing, and the influx of applications has crashed some systems. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>“As today's report shows, the coronavirus outbreak is economically akin to a major hurricane occurring in every state around the country for weeks on end," Glassdoor Senior Economist Daniel Zhao told CNN.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/26/slack-ceo-records-harrowing-march-2020?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A CEO’s Coronavirus Diary
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Wednesday night, we got a colorful account of the early days of the coronavirus crisis for an exec in the eye of the hurricane. Slack CEO Stewart Butterfield posted a <a href="https://twitter.com/stewart/status/1243000487365861376?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axioslogin&stream=top&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Twitter thread</a> detailing his experience of the past few weeks. Some choice excerpts: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Monday, March 2—might as well be cautious: </strong>Slack cancels its annual Global Sales Offsite...and the CTO of a huge asset manager emails Butterfield they’re signing a contract to “go wall-to-wall” on Slack before “tightening up” overall due to the virus. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday, March 11—so this is serious: </strong>After 10pm on the eve of Slack’s third earnings call as a public company, Butterfield and other c-suiters decide to revise guidance as it becomes clear the U.S. outbreak isn’t going to subside.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday, March 12—yes, very serious:</strong> Butterfield helms the call as the stock market imitates a mechanical bull. Butterfield describes waiting for the call to start as “completely surreal.”  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Butterfield is feeling conflicted.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/366/butterfield.png" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="Slack"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>@stewart</em> </small></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SMALL BIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/26/struggling-businesses-turn-gofundme?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Businesses Hit by Coronavirus Go Fund Themselves
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A street of small retailers " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDMvYV9yb3dfb2ZfbG9jYWxfcmV0YWlsZXJzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As the social distancing measures required to limit the spread of the coronavirus bulldoze the economy, many individuals and small businesses are turning to the crowdfunding site GoFundMe, the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/26/style/gofundme-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT reports</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>GoFundMe said it’s experiencing the most demand since it was founded 10 years ago. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Between last Friday and Tuesday, coronavirus-related campaigns on the platform jumped 60% to 35,000. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Behind those efforts are artists, bartenders, and other workers whose jobs evaporated. But a higher-than-usual number of campaigns were started by business owners trying to stay afloat. The site had over 14,000 verified campaigns by small businesses as of Tuesday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">GoFundMe’s trying to help.</strong> It partnered with Yelp to embed campaigns on restaurants’ Yelp sites and match the first $500 small businesses raise. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>In non-pandemic times, 27% of all GoFundMe campaigns hit their goals, per research from the University of Rochester. But the need for support is growing rapidly. Struggling small firms will have to hone their marketing and promotional tactics in order to stand out.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/26/waffle-house-index-shows-coronavirus-impact?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The South Is Warning Us
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="waffle house " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNjcvd2FmZmxlX2hvdXNlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:Angrykeyboarder" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Scott</a>, <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Waffle-House.jpg" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Waffle-House</a>, <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/legalcode" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-SA 3.0</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If that devastating unemployment report wasn't enough to alarm economists, there's another indicator flashing red: <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/03/26/waffle-house-index-coronavirus/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the Waffle House Index</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What that is: </strong>The Waffle House Index (WFI) measures to what extent Waffle House locations remain open. It’s typically used to measure the severity of a natural disaster since the restaurant chain, revered in the American South, is incredibly resilient. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 2011, a tornado tore through Joplin, MO, killing 158 people and injuring over 1,000. The Waffle House remained open. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But now...the WHI is in the red, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/coronavirus-waffle-house-index-red-restaurant-chain-shutters-356-stores-n1168391?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the company announced</a> on Wednesday. Waffle House has closed more than a fifth of its locations in response to the crisis, and its sales are down 70% nationwide, per the WaPo.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>This is the first time analysts have used the Waffle House Index to evaluate the damage of a non-weather-related event.</p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New York Stock Exchange trader Peter Tuchman, the beloved face of a thousand Dow plunges, said yesterday he <a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/B-Mx-_IAA46/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tested positive</a> for the coronavirus.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><span>"Good team of doctors good spiritual support I will see you on the other side crazy guys stay home you do not want to get this," he wrote on Twitter. </span></span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span>The NYSE trading floor has been completely empty since Monday, when the exchange went <a href="https://www.marketplace.org/2020/03/23/nyse-stocks-trading-floor-closed-electronic/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fully electronic</a>.</span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span>Wishing you a speedy recovery, Peter. </span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<img class="story-header-image" alt="puppet eating cars" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/365/puppet_eating_cars.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://twitter.com/gnuman1979/status/1239523796542992387?s=20" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">@gnuman1979</a>/Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Eliza Carter wrote the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/22/guide-nonsports-tv-sports-fans-someone-whos-never-watched-sports?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ultimate TV guide</a> for sports fans with nothing to watch. Now, she's written the ultimate guide for people with not much to do...</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/weight-lifter_1f3cb.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Morning workout</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Do the following circuit 3x: </strong>20 jumping jacks, take the heaviest thing out of your fridge and do 15 squats, 15 pushups, 30-second wall sit, 10 tricep dips, and a 30-second plank. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/video-camera_1f4f9.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Things to send your group chat</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It hasn’t been updated for a bit, but the Instagram account <a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/BW8GrVMFpaR/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">@sand.isfying</a> has a trove of oddly comforting videos of sand. If that’s not for you, try <a href="https://www.instagram.com/seblester/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">@seblester</a>’s lovely calligraphy or <a href="https://www.instagram.com/slimequeeens/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">@slimequeeens</a>’s lovely slime. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/headphone_1f3a7.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Work playlist</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://open.spotify.com/artist/5oOhM2DFWab8XhSdQiITry?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tycho</a>’s music makes me feel like I’m floating through the world on a cotton candy cloud...in a focused way. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/google/241/bento-box_1f371.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Lunch break, but make it productive</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Stay up to date:</strong></span><span> Science writer for The Atlantic </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/edyong209?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ed Yong</a></span><span> is doing a great job helping me wrap my head around the coronavirus crisis. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Do good: </strong></span><span>Many American children rely on school for their meals...and schools are closing across the country. </span><span><a href="https://www.nokidhungry.org/ways-you-can-help/other-ways-give?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">No Kid Hungry</a></span><span> is filling in the gaps.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Level up:</strong></span><span> Adobe is offering </span><span><a href="https://petapixel.com/2020/03/18/adobe-is-giving-everyone-2-months-of-free-creative-cloud-heres-how-to-get-it/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">two months of Creative Cloud</a></span><span>, for free. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/canned-food_1f96b.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Dinner plans</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Any other vegetarians out there? <a href="https://cookieandkate.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Cookie and Kate</a> has simple, amazing recipes. I’ve fed them to omnivores, too, to rave reviews.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/television_1f4fa.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Evening activities</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">No screen:</strong></span><span> Check out </span><span><a href="https://cooking.nytimes.com/learn-to-cook?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the NYT’s guide</a></span><span> to mastering the basics of cooking. There’s a lot more to know about rice than I thought.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Screen: </strong></span><span><a href="https://trickleup.uscreen.io/catalog?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Trickle Up</a></span><span>, which launched Monday, allows you to watch performance videos (plays, comedy, puppeteering) for $10/month. All proceeds go to New York artists in need. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<hr>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/house-with-garden_1f3e1.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">We want you to live your best quarantined life</strong>—so much so, that we launched a brand new, free newsletter to be your guide. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/the-essentials/?utm_medium=onsite&utm_campaign=dailyplanner_032020&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out The Essentials→</a></em></p>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eU.S. markets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNothing makes sense anymore. On a day when an avalanche of weekly unemployment claims stunned the country, stocks staged their \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks/wall-st-rallies-for-third-day-as-job-losses-stir-talk-of-more-stimulus-idUSKBN21D17Z?feedType=RSS\u0026feedName=businessNews\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethird straight rally\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. After surging more than 20% since Monday, the Dow is back in a bull market. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFed: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYou know you’re in an economic crisis when the chairman of the Federal Reserve is doing morning television. Appearing on the \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eToday Show\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, Jerome Powell \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-fed-powell/feds-powell-says-virus-to-dictate-when-u-s-economy-reopens-idUSKBN21D1P9?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eurged patience\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, saying “The first order of business will be to get the spread of the virus under control and then resume economic activity.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nJOBS \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nA Chart You'll Never Forget\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"unemployment chart \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNjQvdW5lbXBsb3ltZW50X2NoYXJ0LnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.epi.org/press/unemployment-insurance-claims-jumped-nearly-1500-in-two-weeks-i-have-been-a-labor-economist-for-a-very-long-time-and-have-never-seen-anything-like-this/\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eEconomic Policy Institute\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eImagine the entire state of Utah filing for unemployment. Yesterday morning, the Labor Department reported something pretty darn close: almost \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/1bae3794481cc9d02fc670480cfcb800?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e3.3 million Americans\u003c/a\u003e filed for unemployment last week, the department’s biggest spike on record.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnemployment applications generally mirror the rate of layoffs. So when claims jump by 3 million in a week, it’s safe to say coronavirus is ravaging the U.S. economy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIs this everyone? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNot even close. Gig workers, freelancers, and the self-employed aren’t eligible for unemployment yet. Nor do jobless claims account for the millions of workers who’ve had hours dramatically reduced or their pay cut. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe pace is unprecedented. \u003c/strong\u003eIn February, unemployment hit a half-century low of 3.5%. Last week’s filings are expected to \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/03/26/821580191/unemployment-claims-expected-to-shatter-records?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epush that\u003c/a\u003e to 5.5% and, if the pandemic and economy worsen, near 13%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBy the end of May, the U.S. could lose twice as many jobs as it did during the Great Recession. Globally, the UN predicts up to 25 million jobs lost.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eStimulus to the rescue?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTreasury Sec. Steve Mnuchin said yesterday’s unemployment numbers are “\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/03/26/economy/unemployment-benefits-coronavirus/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot relevant\u003c/a\u003e” since claims were filed before the Senate passed a \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/senate-passes-2-trillion-stimulus-bill?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$2.2 trillion stimulus package\u003c/a\u003e. He said businesses that receive stimulus benefits “hopefully will be able to hire back a lot of those people.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSpeaker of the House Nancy Pelosi pledged to pass the stimulus today. The bill would expand unemployment benefits including 13 additional weeks of benefits, extra weekly payments of up to $600 for four months, and benefits for individuals not on company payrolls, like gig economy workers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThose changes should allow the average worker to receive roughly \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/03/25/821514231/whats-in-it-for-you-1-200-checks-13-weeks-of-unemployment-payments-and-more?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e100% wage replacement\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, NPR reports. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA separate bill provides $1 billion to states to help process claims. Many unemployment agencies are working with historically low funding and staffing, and the influx of applications has crashed some systems. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003e“As today's report shows, the coronavirus outbreak is economically akin to a major hurricane occurring in every state around the country for weeks on end,\" Glassdoor Senior Economist Daniel Zhao told CNN.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Wednesday night, we got a colorful account of the early days of the coronavirus crisis for an exec in the eye of the hurricane. Slack CEO Stewart Butterfield posted a \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/stewart/status/1243000487365861376?utm_source=newsletter\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_campaign=newsletter_axioslogin\u0026stream=top\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eTwitter thread\u003c/a\u003e detailing his experience of the past few weeks. Some choice excerpts: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMonday, March 2—might as well be cautious: \u003c/strong\u003eSlack cancels its annual Global Sales Offsite...and the CTO of a huge asset manager emails Butterfield they’re signing a contract to “go wall-to-wall” on Slack before “tightening up” overall due to the virus. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWednesday, March 11—so this is serious: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter 10pm on the eve of Slack’s third earnings call as a public company, Butterfield and other c-suiters decide to revise guidance as it becomes clear the U.S. outbreak isn’t going to subside.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThursday, March 12—yes, very serious:\u003c/strong\u003e Butterfield helms the call as the stock market imitates a mechanical bull. Butterfield describes waiting for the call to start as “completely surreal.”  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eButterfield is feeling conflicted.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs the social distancing measures required to limit the spread of the coronavirus bulldoze the economy, many individuals and small businesses are turning to the crowdfunding site GoFundMe, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/26/style/gofundme-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNYT reports\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGoFundMe said it’s experiencing the most demand since it was founded 10 years ago. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBetween last Friday and Tuesday, coronavirus-related campaigns on the platform jumped 60% to 35,000. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBehind those efforts are artists, bartenders, and other workers whose jobs evaporated. But a higher-than-usual number of campaigns were started by business owners trying to stay afloat. The site had over 14,000 verified campaigns by small businesses as of Tuesday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGoFundMe’s trying to help.\u003c/strong\u003e It partnered with Yelp to embed campaigns on restaurants’ Yelp sites and match the first $500 small businesses raise. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eIn non-pandemic times, 27% of all GoFundMe campaigns hit their goals, per research from the University of Rochester. But the need for support is growing rapidly. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat that is: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Waffle House Index (WFI) measures to what extent Waffle House locations remain open. It’s typically used to measure the severity of a natural disaster since the restaurant chain, revered in the American South, is incredibly resilient. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn 2011, a tornado tore through Joplin, MO, killing 158 people and injuring over 1,000. The Waffle House remained open. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut now...the WHI is in the red, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/coronavirus-waffle-house-index-red-restaurant-chain-shutters-356-stores-n1168391?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe company announced\u003c/a\u003e on Wednesday. Waffle House has closed more than a fifth of its locations in response to the crisis, and its sales are down 70% nationwide, per the WaPo.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThis is the first time analysts have used the Waffle House Index
